009package Ch02_Histograms_Statistics;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.image.IntegralImage;
018import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
019
020import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * This ImageJ plugin calculates the integral image for the current image (8 bit grayscale only) and displays the
025 * resulting first and second order summed area tables (S1, S2) as floating-point images. See Sec. 2.8.1 of [1] for
026 * additional details.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
030 * (2022).
031 * </p>
032 *
033 * @author WB
034 */
035public class Integral_Image_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
036
037        /** Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open. */
038        public Integral_Image_Demo() {
039                if (noCurrentImage()) {
040                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.IrishManor);
041                }
042        }
043
044        @Override
045        public int setup(String arg0, ImagePlus im) {
046                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES;
047        }
048
049        @Override
050        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {                    
051                IntegralImage iI = new IntegralImage((ByteProcessor) ip);       
052                long[][] S1 = iI.getS1();
053                long[][] S2 = iI.getS2();
054                
055                FloatProcessor fS1 = new FloatProcessor(toFloatArray(S1));
056                new ImagePlus("S1", fS1).show();
057                
058                FloatProcessor fS2 = new FloatProcessor(toFloatArray(S2));
059                new ImagePlus("S2", fS2).show();
060        }
061        
062        private float[][] toFloatArray(long[][] A) {
063                float[][] B = new float[A.length][A[0].length];
064                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
065                        for (int j = 0; j < A[0].length; j++) {
066                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
067                        }
068                }
069                return B;
070        }
071
072}
